page.title: 09TRADE,SHOPPING IN RADCLIFFE
page.content: THE FOLLOWING RESULTS ARE FROM QUESTIONNAIRES ON 100 SHOPPERS IN RADCLIFFE TO ILLUSTRATE THE AMENITY COUNT 50% OF THOSE INTERVIEWED SHOPPED WEEKLY,20% TWICE WEEKLY. ASDA SUPERSTORE WAS THE MOST POPULAR SHOP, FOLLOWED BY KWIKSAVE AND THE MARKET. 90% OF ALL SHOPPERS WERE BUYING FOOD. 80% OF ALL SHOPPERS WENT OUT OF RADCLIFFE TO BUY LARGE AND EXPENSIVE ITEMS BECAUSE OF THE LIMITED CHOICE IN THE TOWN. MANY CAR OWNERS FOUND PARKING INADEQUATE. 75% OF SHOPPERS WERE ESTIMATED TO BE BETWEEN 20 AND 40 YEARS. WHEN ASKED TO COMMENT ON ANY PROBLEMS,CRITICISMS OF THE SHOPPING AREA INCLUDED MORE CHAIN STORES,MORE CLOTHES SHOPS,A BIGGER MARKET,MORE TOILETS AND MORE LITTER BINS.
